question: Which country unveiled world's steepest funicular railway link to the alpine resort of Stoos?
explanation: Switzerland unveiled world's steepest funicular railway link to the alpine resort of Stoos. Funicular is a type of cable railway (a cable attached to a pair of tram-like vehicles on rails) on an inclined pane of cliff. The latest funicular unveiled in Switzerland rises 743 metres along gradients as steep as 110% and has a track length of 1720 metres.
